website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive DNA test kit associated with a well-respected genealogical database. May answer some general questions about ethnicity and extended family connections.
pros: More affordable than other DNA kits on the market
Living relatives with similar DNA traits can be located or contacted
Raw DNA data can be transferred to other sites
cons: Results are not as specific as some customers expected
Reports of very slow response times

customer_reviews.title: my family is so sad that he never had the opportunity to learn his ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two kits for my parents last year; they were so excited to learn their ancestry. They followed the instructions accordingly, and mailed in with the prepaid boxes. A year later, still no results and it's impossible to contact the company. This past August my father passed away and I am beyond furious that we will never know his results. More importantly, my family is so sad that he never had the opportunity to learn his results. He truly looked forward to learning. Total waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Akers

customer_reviews.title: AncestryDNA is not for East Asians.
customer_reviews.text: My ancestors were from Korea. One of our daughters submitted her saliva to the 23 and me and discovered that she had Korean, Chinese and Japanese genes which wasn't surprising. Mine from the AncestryDNA, however, declared that I am 100% East Asian with a huge circled region encompassing Siberia to the north, Japan to the east, Indonesia to the south, and Bangladesh to the west. The map is attached. What a waste of money and effort! The Ancestry DNA should have a big warning that their test isn't for East Asians.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this product at all. I feel like it is just a gimmick. They are very vague on what countries you are from it said Eastern European and when you click on it it named over 15 different countries. I knew I was eastern european and when it lists every country in eastern europe it kind of defeats the purpose...
customer_reviews.author: J.R.H

customer_reviews.title: I've done both 23andme & AncestryDNA
customer_reviews.text: AncestryDNA provides vague, general, limited results. 23andme provides more specific details (mtDNA, yDNA, haplogroups) for the same price ($99). You definitely get more bang for your buck with 23andme.
customer_reviews.author: lefteyetwitch

customer_reviews.title: A complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: A complete waste of money. It showed me possibly from Asian and Polynesian group thousands of years ago. That is it. No other information what so ever. I don't know if this is because I am Asian - maybe their database has very little information for Asians.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Nu

customer_reviews.title: 64% Europe West 24% Great Britain 12% Other regions While it might be correct
customer_reviews.text: absolute junk. This is what came back: Ethnicity Estimate: 64% Europe West 24% Great Britain 12% Other regions While it might be correct, it is worthless. telling me I am 64% Western European without breaking down the countries is ridiculous. Do not waste your time or money
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Need disclaimer for Asians
customer_reviews.text: They should put a disclaimer that they cannot breakdown Asians by ethnicity. Paid money for them to have data but received useless results and it took longer than they say.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Kim

customer_reviews.title: My half sister and I are united because of this DNA test!
customer_reviews.text: The AncestryDNA test confirmed a half sister that I never knew I had. Unfortunately, my mother passed away almost 27 years ago when I was just 12 years old, so I can't get any information from her. Finding my new older sister is like having a piece of my mom back. We'll be forever grateful to Ancestry for providing the tools to discover each other.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany.l.g

customer_reviews.title: Results Aren’t  Accurate
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been wanting to know more about his paternal DNA. He has the history on his maternal side. His grandparents immigrated from Denmark, his great-grandfather was a guard for the Danish king. We even have pictures. His results only showed that he’s 7% Scandinavian. If you what serious results this probably isn’t the source you want to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No access to results allowed from outside the United States
customer_reviews.text: Although the company does not disclose this problem on their website, customers cannot view their test results on browsers outside the United States. The login process gives the error "Internal error. There was a problem servicing your request — the details have been automatically logged to our servers." Unfortunately, their Android application is inadequate and too small on my telephone to easily view the results. After a half hour on the Ancestry telephone support, I was informed that they do not allow access while overseas, not even military personnel, accept through the telephone app. They then refused to issue a refund. Do not buy unless you only intend to access your results within the US.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: CAVEAT EMPTOR
customer_reviews.text: We sent a DNA submission in January 2017. March 15th Ancestry emailed "Unfortunately, after multiple attempts, we were unable to use the sample you sent to AncestryDNA." We resubmitted the DNA and they acknowledged receipt of the sample on April 3. Since then all we have received are tons of email advertisements for ANCESTRY DNA. NO DNA results. ALL WE WANT IS WHAT WE PAID FOR. It's really that simple.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting...
customer_reviews.text: Promptly sent in my DNA kit once it arrived and mailed it back as instructed. It was received by ancestry DNA on the 9th of February. Logged in today, April 5th, to see they are finally processing my results and that I can now expect them to be ready in 6-8 weeks. Very disappointed for the long wait.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Experience
customer_reviews.text: This has been a horrible experience. Both my wife and I are trying for the third time to get results. Each time it’s been two months at the lab for them to come back and say they aren’t able to get the results and to try again. We requested our money back after the second time and although they said yes they didn’t refund us. So we keep re-ordering the test only to have them come back with no results! Horrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This test is complete and utter crap. It's so vague
customer_reviews.text: This test is complete and utter crap. It's so vague, it only tells you huge regions. So I learned I could be Spanish, Portuguese, Moroccan, Italian, French, German, British, Irish, English, Norwegian, Swedish, Polish... seriously so lame. I still have no idea what I am. 👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Sage Lourdes

customer_reviews.title: Adopted? Looking for Biological Family?
customer_reviews.text: 1) So much cheaper then hiring investigators to dig up your background 2) Cheaper then the courts 3) Best way to by-pass closed adoptions :) Its worked for me, I've found half of my Biological Family. Now Ancestry take a bit of time to navigate to learn what to do during the free period, but worth paying for a year if you truly want to find your family. Took me 2 years and lots of work, so don't give up... Best of Luck
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Michael Nejedly

customer_reviews.title: Worst results out there
customer_reviews.text: Worst results out there ... more expensive than others and very vague results ... hard to view results Save your money and go with someone else, a little cheaper and way more detailed than this ... my grandparents are from Italy and that's basically what they told me ... VERY DISAPPOINTING In Addition, there are more adds on the result page than information They have also filled the results with a copy and paste Google history lesson which just tells general facts and nothing specific about you or your family It's truly the worst result page I have ever seen of any DNA testing, do not order DNA from here ... go someplace else !
customer_reviews.author: Mariilove

customer_reviews.title: Results are inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting to do ancestry for years now, it went on sale for $60 so i finally decided to do it. I bought it about a month ago and just got my results today. It claims I am about 5 dfferent things from europe, with no native american background. I know for a fact I have at least 35% native american. I wouldn’t trust it completely. I think they just extract your dna and see you’re white/or black/or asian and play around with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Asians: go with 23 and me
customer_reviews.text: I’m Korean. My sister-in-law who is also Korean took a 23 And Me test and got detailed information that showed she had Japanese and Chinese heritage and estimated percentages and timeframes. I thought I’d pay a little less for the AncestryDNA test thinking I’d get similar detail and now wish I’d paid a little more for 23 And Me. I waited 4-6 weeks for Ancestry to tell me I’m 100% East Asian which basically covers the area of North America. Gee, thanks. I wish i could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Attn Asians: don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Wanting to see from which specific parts of Asia your ancestors hailed? Then do not get this product. All it literally said was: “east Asian” and did not break it down into specific nationalities like I’ve heard 23&me does. One positive is if you are looking for long lost relatives, then it matches you with people who have similar dna.
customer_reviews.author: Hy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: My last name is Griffin, which would automatically put my relatives in the British Isles. Guess what, that’s all they reported, said no possibility of Native American ancestry. Strange that I have Indian relatives in Broken Arrow, Oklahoma from my paternal side of the family. I think they saw my last name and went with the obvious. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Griffin

customer_reviews.title: A Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have absolutely no idea what ethnicity you are, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY on this. Not only do they spam your email with offers to spend more of your money, but my results told me I was Asian. Not any specific types of Asian. I didn't need an expensive test to tell me that news. They make it seem like you get a lot more specific results. I have a list of 20+ countries my DNA COULD be associated with, but nothing even close to narrowing it down. I can't say, "Oh, I just found out I am _________ and _________ and __________." Anyone with eyes could have told me I was Asian. Lame!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M

customer_reviews.title: Comparable with many other DNA sites but poor internal DNA tools
customer_reviews.text: I tried all major tests: FamilyTreeDNA, 23andMe and AncestryDNA. Relative to other tests, AncestryDNA has very week tools and has very expensive subscription service. Why am I giving 5 Starts? Compatability! With AncestryDNA you get the largest DNA database AND it's raw DNA data can be uploaded to most other sites for additional matches and tools analyses, including FamilyTreeDNA and GEDmatch.com. So get AncestryDNA to use its raw data with other services. Otherwise, FamilyTreeDNA has much better research tools. I would use 23andMe only if you are interested in health reports. 23andMe data is not most other databases.
customer_reviews.author: theal

customer_reviews.title: not detailed at all
customer_reviews.text: Results are very poor. It says I am Eastern European. What a surprise. Nothing else. I have different nationalities in my grandparents that were not listed at all. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: A. kaunator

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for asian ancestry
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this kit expecting atleast some sort of specificity to the region. Instead I was told I am 100% east asian and then provided a map encompassing parts of india up to russia and down to new zealand. Basically 2/3 of the world was filled in as to my origins. If youre asian do not use this, ive heard 23andme is better. If youre of european descent then ive heard this is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Chopster

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time with this one
customer_reviews.text: I was rather disappointed with this test. I expected it to be more in depth. Instead it seemed to just skim the surface. I later used the raw data to run through another site and that did increase the amount of information I got drastically. I had to find that site through unrelated genealogy groups though. Before that I had a chunk of "unidentified" data. It's a lot of money to pay for a service that doesn't give detailed info. On top of that when you agree to their terms of service by sending in the sample you are giving them rights to your DNA and paying them to let them have it.
customer_reviews.author: Kikyo

customer_reviews.title: WARNING ⚠️ DO NOT let your child be the 1st to see the results
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift. What was done in fun had a sad outcome. I’ve met people that found out one of the parents had an affair and many, many secrets.WARNING ⚠️ DO NOT let your child make his or hers public until you see the results. That said, it was fun to see your Ancestry
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: LAUGHABLE - MONEY, DOWN THE ANCESTRAL DRAIN
customer_reviews.text: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY! A joke. I was looking for some more details, not generalizations in areas. And for more info (that they dangle in front of you) you've got to pay more money. Then, what would you receive? I could look at a world map, find Norway (where I knew I had ancestors) use a push pin and have the same results AncestryDNA gave me. IT * DID * NOT * DELIVER ~ DON'T BUY THIS KIT! Not only that, trying to get back into their website after you've viewed your miniscule heritage - you can't enter it again w/o getting error messages. A TOTAL, RIP # OFF!
customer_reviews.author: EMC

customer_reviews.title: I have also tested with another major company and those were useless for genealogy purposes
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 8 of these and am now buying two more. These tests have confirmed much of my genealogy research. They have also debunked some genealogy paper trails but that is okay as I want accuracy. I have had genealogy lines open up that had been brick walls for decades. I have also used these tests to determine birth parents. But expect that you will have to learn how to use the results and you will have to work with the results. I have also tested with another major company and those were useless for genealogy purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Blew my mind - Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I took this test 15 years too late as both my parents and everyone from their generation is now gone. This test revealed that I was not the biological son of the Italian Immigrant I thought I was. With digging, I found out my mother was married early - unfortunately I found my true biological father long after he passed. The test gives you answers to questions you wish you never had.
customer_reviews.author: JohnO.

customer_reviews.title: Not what it advertized
customer_reviews.text: Yes it gives you very basic information about countries and regions where your ancestors may be from. However, if you want to dig even a little deeper, then you will need to cough up a minimum of $20 per month. Find a high probability dna match? then pay to get more info. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper McFearson

customer_reviews.title: Please Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: They tell me that I am 33% Irish, yet when you click on it, it gives me a range of 0% to 47%... So you mean to tell me that there is a possibility that am actually 0% Irish? I just don't understand how they can advertise that it is such an accurate product when they are using ranges like this. Additionally, I was expecting to be able to look into those who have matched with me, yet everything I click on leads me to a screen of them trying to sell me their membership plans. All in all, this is a scam of a product that is a total waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Subscription is expensive over time
customer_reviews.text: Ancestry DNA tests are decent, and they claim to have the largest database, so if you are doing DNA geneology, you kinda HAVE to test here (as well as a couple more sites) but kinda sucks that they make you maintain a monthly subscription to do research. Much of the same data is available on familysearch.org for free. Make sure to download your RAW data file and upload to familytreedna.com autosomal transfer as well as gedmatch. Once I have my tree well enough built out, I will be nixing the monthly sub.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: The best gift you can give.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom for Christmas. She had been wanting it for such a long time being that she didnt know anything about her father other than a name. She submitted the kit by the beginning of Jan and it matched her to a first cousin. Her cousin confirmed her father's name and was able to point us in the direction of my mothers siblings. By Feb 2nd she found out she had brothers and sisters and was able to communicate with them. This product changed my moms life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless for Asians
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worthless for Asians. 99% East Asian? A complete waste of money. I didn't need to shell out $50 for someone to tell me I'm Asian. It's not even country specific--it just lumps you with 17 different countries. Don't buy if you're a minority. Only specific if you're white.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Adds insight to research
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Fascinating results. Discovered a distant relative was actually adopted. All these years I thought I was mostly Swedish. With the help of this dna kit and researching the ancestry.com database, turns out my relative was born German and adopted by Swedish parents.
customer_reviews.author: ERA

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for me
customer_reviews.text: I am entirely displeased with ancestry. I did not find the sparse information very useful and I somehow signed up for a monthly account that I discovered a few months after I took the initial test. I called to complain about the monthly subscription, I was on hold for over 30 minutes and gave up. For me, the information I received was not worth $99. Simultaneously, I took the 23andme ($199) test and found the results very thorough and informative.
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ancestry DNA kit on January 2nd. I sent it in a few days later. My mother in law purchased a 23andme kit and we mailed it off on the same day. She received her results several weeks ago now. And according to the Ancestry DNA website, they are just barely extracting my DNA from the kit and shouldn't expect to see my results until early March. That is completely unbelievable!! I think I wasted my money on this test kit...
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T.

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: DNA results come back and they are not accurate, even your own brothers and sisters come back different and all they try to do is UPSELL you on all sorts of packages once they suck you into this saga! They explained to me that sorry, yes everyone in your entire family can be a different DNA Heritage! So why don't they tell you that in the beginning? Because you wouldn't waste your money on it! Sorry, Amazon should be ashamed of themselves for selling this!
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Bono

customer_reviews.title: AND SHE SURE LOOK LIKE A BEAUTIFUL APACHE LADY
customer_reviews.text: BOY! THIS SURE GAVE BIG WOW! SOMETHING THAT TOTALLY SURPRISED ME FOR SURE! I THOUGHT I HAD ASIAN HERITAGE BECAUSE A LOT OF MY AUNTS AND UNCLES AND MY GRANDFATHER LOOK ASIAN. SO I GET MY DNA AND IT TELL ME I AM 57% NATIVE AMERICAN ;) !ALL MY LIFE I'VE MARKED ON MY APPS. LATINA/MEXICAN, AFTER SOME RESEARCH COME TO FIND OUT MY GRANDFATHER WAS FILLPINO .MYGRANDMOTHER WAS 100% NATIVE AMERICAN . I WAS TOLD SHE WAS APACHE. AND SHE SURE LOOK LIKE A BEAUTIFUL APACHE LADY. I LOVED HER SO MUCH AND STILL MISS HER. I AM SO PROUD TO BE A NATIVE AMERICAN!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably accurate, but poorly exhibited.
customer_reviews.text: Based on paper trail genealogy studies I have done, and on other DNA tests I have taken, this appears to have quite a good level of accuracy, while still giving me a bit of new info I did not have. BUT: I consider the graphics of the regions maps to be very poor. They are way below the standard set by another DNA company I used. I could (and might) probably generate a better looking map here on my home computer using the data provided, than what I received from Ancestry.com. Back on the plus side, they delivered results much faster than they said they would, and I do appreciate that.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jester

customer_reviews.title: Where do you come from?
customer_reviews.text: After getting wildly unexpected, unsupported by any of the genealogy information on hand, from MyHertiage.com, my spouse and I tried Ancestry.com. The results for both of us were much more in line with what we knew from family sources, and are further supported by Ancestry.com's 'hints'. The 'hints' are part of the premium services that will cost you extra starting at about $99 for 6 months. I believe the free service allows you to build as big a family tree as you can, whereas other genealogy sites limit the free tree size. You can also see your DNA matches, although a premium subscription is required to reveal any details.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kersh

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product did not give me any trace of my ancestors migration. Other DNA analyzing products I was told had diagrams with migration patterns tracing the persons ancestors from centuries ago. I knew my origin. Ancestry.com didn't add anything to my knowledge. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amir S.

customer_reviews.title: Found a new 1st cousin and a cousin once removed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to confirm my heritage , which it did - no surprises. I matched on a cousin I didn't know I had. This person was looking for relatives, and it turned out my uncle had a child decades ago that no one was aware of. Ditto for a cousin of mine. So for those searching for relatives this was a gift as I was the first match for my new cousin which helped them to find other relatives. The two new relatives went to a family reunion summer of 2018. 1 star removed for additional costs required for additional features.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Too Vague "Northern Europe"
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with how vague the results were "northern europe." That can mean a lot of different things. Our family hoped to learn what country we had the biggest connection to. Unfortunately this test did non help provide more insight. Over priced test for such limited insight.
customer_reviews.author: booksmart81

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful wonderful gift
customer_reviews.text: Wow... hubby was extremely excited and grateful to get this. He did it immediately and when he received the results...everyone was shocked. That so called familt trait... "German temper" was only maybe 12%... Hubby has more Wales and English ancestry going back too 1700. Which incredibly explains his obsession with thise areas when we have travelled in the past. Channel islands, Wales, England. Who know at that time thats where his people were from. He felt such a deep connection in Wales at a Medieval castle. I have a picture of him hugging the castle walls. Loved this stepping stone to his history.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Plamann

customer_reviews.title: Limited Results - Mostly a Sales Pitch
customer_reviews.text: The DNA results were fairly accurate (compared to another popular brand), however they were very general. My results were regions, i.e. Baltics, Eastern Europe, etc. They couldn't give any more specific information than those high-level results, which was very disappointing. Additionally, to get any information beyond basics, they want you to pay for various upgrades and subscriptions. Given the test is pretty expensive to begin with, this is such a rip-off. Also, this took a month and half to get results. You're better off with the 'other' company who will be faster, more specific, and more transparent with information.
customer_reviews.author: blair

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The test is easy to do and we got our results within 2 weeks. Which was awesome. But the results are very vague. I am Vietnamese and it said I was East Asia....which includes a ton of countries so it doesn't narrow down or specify anything. I could be part Thai, Chinese, Cambodian and I wouldn't know because it's all grouped as East Asian.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Very basic.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up having to buy a whole other test kit from 23andMe because this one didn’t have a lot of things I wanted. A list of famous people you’re related to, a health report, or option for maternal/paternal line report. I should have researched more in the first place. If all you want is the basics, then this is fine, but I only paid a little bit more money and got so much more in return with 23andMe.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Found sister we never knew we had
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh! True life story. My family found out we have an older sister that our mother gave up for adoption. She had been looking for her bio family for years and this test made it possible for her to find us! It's absolutely the BEST money ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Sherrill

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend buying through Amazon. No Ancestry recourse.
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend buying through Amazon. Activated kit through Ancestry.Com but their customer service stated that it was never activated. I stated that I did activate and received confirmation that kit was activated successfully. That was in February of this year. The Ancestry rep. stated for me to contact Amazon to replace the kit since there was a "glitch" on Ancestry's end. I stated that it was not Amazon's fault and I am sure they will not agree to give a free replacement. Not impressed with Ancestry.Com.
customer_reviews.author: Rad5030

customer_reviews.title: Subjective Analysis
customer_reviews.text: It's accuracy is only related to the population of Ancestry DNA participants in the pool and not a cross section of actual DNA from the much greater group of non Ancestry DNA partakers . Thus it is skewed misleadingly. My DNA was 96 % Gaelic. My mother was Irish but my Father was French .However your last DNA update showed I had no direct French DNA, merely 2% Eoropean. Quite an imbalance. Previously you had shown a 6% French DNA content. So I'm guessing the updated data (96%/2%) came from a significant increase in later Gaelic Ancestry members. and no or little French ancestry members in that same period.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: I already knew my family came to the US from Europe. My results came back as 100% European with the entire continent circled. When I got the results, I thought it was a joke, kept looking for more details but nothing. Obviously, there was no real DNA analysis done if anything at all. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: 100% European

customer_reviews.title: Not an exact science, but the results were broadly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm lucky enough to have about 1000 years of my family history thoroughly documented and so I just took the DNA test to confirm what I already knew. The results were very close indeed, and when I checked my DNA matches I found some family members I already knew about so I can confirm they were legitimate! No real surprises in my results, I already knew I was very, very British with a little mix of Scandinavia and Ireland. So, I can't speak for everyone but in my case I would give it an A+.
customer_reviews.author: Chris HorryTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Not very accurate...
customer_reviews.text: My mother's ancestry matched family history pretty well as far back as we can trace it. On my father's side, it's 100% Spanish from NW Spain near Portugal. The first test was only 1% Spain, the rest across Italy to Greece. The update 4 months later was 0% Spanish. With several generations of intermarriage in the same few regional villages in NW Spain, the diversity plot alone should have approached 50% Iberian peninsula. It's definitely oversold as to accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: S. B. Alonso

customer_reviews.title: This test is worth buying
customer_reviews.text: I bought this test to figure out who my biological father was and took alot of work but I was able to figure it out. I now help fatherless and adoptee's find Bio-parents and this test is very much helpful figuring out the mystery. This test Ethnicity is a little off as well as all companies and probably more accurate then most. I however look at matches more than I look at ethnicity. Your DNA results with Ancestry can be downloaded and re-uploaded for free to FTDNA, MyHeritage and GEDmatch.com. If you are looking for family, it's best to do 23andme as well but start with the bigger pond which is Ancestry.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: returned
customer_reviews.text: had to return could not use and when I called they were so busy because they oversold and could not help me and also said the results would've been way over the 8weeks .This was all on a recording when I called.
customer_reviews.author: tc

customer_reviews.title: 23andme is way better. So disappointed with the lack of information about ...
customer_reviews.text: 23andme is way better. So disappointed with the lack of information about my DNA background on Ancestry. 23andme was more specific and even shows percentages. I bought both tests as a way to compare the results and by far 23and me was the best.
customer_reviews.author: Gabie

customer_reviews.title: You’ll never get your results from Ancestry, stick with 23andme
customer_reviews.text: I had to redo my test because they couldn’t get enough dna from my initial test. Months after resubmitting and linking the new test to my account, I tried to log in to view the results. My account shows no test linked to it, and when I tried to re-enter the test number it says the test is linked to another account. I tried using their automated help number to resolve this, but it never connected me to a person and hung up on me after making me fill out their “satisfaction” survey without having ever connected me to a person. I will be contacting Ancestry for a refund. Stick with 23andme...
customer_reviews.author: Helpful Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer and tester beware! Results may not be what you expect!
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this unless your ready to have your life as you know it sent into a frenzy! You can’t un-see the results once you open the results.
customer_reviews.author: kathie

customer_reviews.title: Great Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Recently someone contacted my son saying they had taken the test and it suggested there might be a link. After a number of discussions, I decided to take the DNA test. It did confirm there was a connection. This part was interesting. The only disappointment was in realizing that only with those who have also taken the test will definitive results be seen. Ancestry suggests memberships and other routes they offer to more fully see ancestral links. I'm sure this will be of interest to some who fully want to trace family history. For me, the DNA test seems more of a teaser in the hope I will sign on to pay for more results.
customer_reviews.author: Mallard

customer_reviews.title: what a waste of time
customer_reviews.text: We have had 3 genealogists study our family history (due to illness) so we have plenty of records of our family history. I'm glad I bought it at 50% off because the results are about 50% off. I'll do 23 and me and another one that was recommended since a geneticist actually runs the program. Ancestry is good for doing your own looking at records (make sure they actually cancel your card when you tell them to. They billed my mother for months and wouldn't refund the mistake despite us having the print out confirming the cancellation. Underwhelmed with the service as usual.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleC

customer_reviews.title: DIsappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in my results. I filled out some of the family tree and felt that they used those common names to influence/determine ethnicity. But there were some uncommon names that I believed were a certain ethnicity based on family stories, but no match. ALso have some obvious American Indian in me, but nothing showed up (based on the family names?) Were I to take another test, I would not fill put a family tree at all. May try another company and not fill out the family tree. On the positive, I got my results sooner than the published turnaround time
customer_reviews.author: reader922

customer_reviews.title: I am having fun looking at my matches!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the kit Dec 3rd, and had my results by Dec 31st. It was really interesting to see a few people like 2nd or 3rd cousins who I am familiar with to the 4th cousins who I never knew existed. I did this to try to find a Portuguese connection since my grandfather came here with nobody. In the 5th thru 8th cousins, I am finding the PORTUGUESE last names and people and even one with the same last name as my grandfather. Just a real eye opener. It's fun to feel connected!
customer_reviews.author: L. Byrge

customer_reviews.title: We love using Ancestry.
customer_reviews.text: I have done my DNA testing with Dante Labs, 23andme, and with Ancestry. For finding blood family members, I highly suggest using Ancestry. For medical, I would suggest Dante Labs. I have spent an embarrassing amount of hours online with Ancestry web page making our family trees. We love Ancestry.
customer_reviews.author: JWatts

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for Father's Day. It took FOREVER to get the results back and when we got them, they were very basic. I mean... yeah, it broke it down but not well. I like the relative thing but it shows their screen name not their real name which is really dumb. Overall, you don't learn much. Save your money and spend it on one of the VERY in depth tests. This is not one of them. Probably wouldn't recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Nothing in regards to my ethnicity,  just 1-40% chance a relative lived in 1 of 3 countries
customer_reviews.text: Results are not specific, from their general guesstimates. Not at all what the implied description, says. Used language and verbiage, to imply results would contain certain specific information, which the genertic, non specific guesstimate, gives me no information, I could not guess myself. Implied results are generic, general, non specific, from info they gather from my questionnaires and other customers with same last name. No DNA results ~Just a qustimate of the possible countries, I may or may not have had ancestors live at one time. Telling me, there's a 1-40% CHANCE, I maybe may have not, had an ancestor, that may have possibly lived in england, wales or ireland, does not even give me a hint of my ethnicity
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Thérèse

customer_reviews.title: Wait for a sale!
customer_reviews.text: So these are cool. This one I ended up sending back because it went on sale a week after I bought it and they didn’t want to refund the difference. But I have bought a couple in the past as gifts. Idk how accurate they are when it comes to where your ancestors came from, but when you link them online it does bring up some relatives, some you know, some you don’t. Definitely a cool tool when figuring out some genealogy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Get 23 and me! Their website is much better!
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use but they all are when it comes to packaging up your spit. My wife did 23 and me, and I did this. What I HATE is the ancestry website is one big upsell. It has interesting info, but you have to pay extra to see it. 23 and me website that my wife has is considerably better and without the panhandling! This one is cheaper, and now I know why. Pass on this and get 23 and me!
customer_reviews.author: Family shoppers!

customer_reviews.title: Found biological family using Ancestry!
customer_reviews.text: I found my biological father, two half sisters and verified my biological mother was indeed who I thought she was.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: OK, but not as good as 23andme
customer_reviews.text: I had done a DNA test using 23andme some months ago, and I decided to do a test using AncestryDNA to see if the results would be the same. Basically they were (I am mostly of British and Germanic descent), but the AncestryDNA results were much more vague and less detailed than with 23andme.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff White

customer_reviews.title: Ancestry can sell or use your genetic information
customer_reviews.text: If I pay Ancestry to help me learn about my family heritage, why are they allowed to sell my genetic information or use it in other ways? Read the fine print. The ramifications to the individual can be huge.
customer_reviews.author: Frogwar23

customer_reviews.title: Fun and informative
customer_reviews.text: It was interesting to find out that everything that I had heard I was and wasn't was not the case. Unfortunately it's more of a scam to get more money out of you and very tough to connect with people who are related to you. They just keep asking for more money
customer_reviews.author: charles moore

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for myself and my husband back for Christmas 2017. It was easy to use and we got our results fairly quickly considering it was during the holiday season. We also found out my husband had an older brother that he didn’t know about! It was shocking but we’re so happy we did these tests because we’re able to connect with family we didn’t even know we had.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla

customer_reviews.title: A complete rip off
customer_reviews.text: A complete waste of my money. Not only did they never give me the results [they did say thay received my sample], but I was never able to either get another kit because the now lost the "results" after seven months but I was NOT able to get a refund. Do not use this product it is a COMPLETE RIP OFF.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unknown father found
customer_reviews.text: I just want say WOW! I ordered this for my husband. His mother didn’t know who gathered him so he grew up not knowing. It was a long shot but he did it and sent it in. He was linked to a 1st cousin that he did not know, messaged her and she was able to say she may have know his father, and that she was not his cousin, she was his aunt. Long story short, my husband found his father who was in the Marine corps. So happy for this product. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Vivian F.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It was amusing information basically just what areas your dna has been historically. Was disappointed how high level it was though, not very detailed, and if you are black or Asian I think you get even less info. It would have been much better if they gave you a month of the subscription service or something included but instead it just constant tries to upsell you to their subscription service. Kinda lame.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: No results, no way to reach a person, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I'll update this if there are results soon. Activated on Nov 29, then received, extracted, and processing all by Dec 8. Has a notice on "analyzing" --Due to high demand, our lab is a little behind schedule. But, rest assured – your DNA kit has been received, and we are working diligently to deliver your results. We are doing our very best to get them to you as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience.--Estimated Date for Results: Dec 28-- It is now Jan 9, 2019. Nothing. Guess I just lost $50.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest L. Johnson III

customer_reviews.title: i prefer to purchase from amazon
customer_reviews.text: buying it from amazon was a great option cause you don't have to pay the extra shipping and the sales are the same as on the site. We got our results in about 2 weeks and have found new family members. The results are slightly general area though so not for people looking to dig waaay deep. Though we have enjoyed using ancestry to find new family members. We always buy a new test for some else in the every Christmas while they are on sale for 49$ to 59$.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Carter

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: Received results stating I am 92% East Asian which included all countries in that region. It's not what I saw in their commercials. Super disappointed. I would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh...it’s okay...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the AncestryDNA kit, it was easy to use. The results were below expectations. I’ve used other DNA kits that provided A LOT more information in regards to ethnicity and migration patterns. For example other DNA kits showed 7+ ethnicities and more detailed migration. This kit showed two ethnicities and literally 2 migrations dating back to 1700 and forward. This is probably a good kit if you are trying to find relatives, it was accurate there. Overall I was disappointed because I had read/heard that the DNA results were supposed to show more insight into genetic makeup. Oh well...
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Reunited and it felt so good.
customer_reviews.text: I knew who both of my parents were before taking this. I was raised by my mother and saw my father various times in life. I bought this test to get an idea of where my ancestors once were and where my African side came from since we only can trace slavery. I loves the results and thought everything about the kit was easy peasy. Upon receiving the results, I saw my father was on the site under DNA Matches as my dad of course. Well it had been years since seeing him. The site allowed him to message me and we reconnected. It felt amazing. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Woman!

customer_reviews.title: After seeing mind blowing results, I gave this as a very well received gift!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my sister in law, knowing she would have fun with this kind of gift being able to receive the kind of information it provides. What convinced me that it was the real deal and an amazing gift is that I have a close personal friend who was able to find her birth father and siblings she never knew she had after receiving her results. She had been searching for over 30 years before she gave this a try. Bam now she has a family she hasn’t previously known. Could there ever be a better endorsement for a product???
customer_reviews.author: Dickers

customer_reviews.title: They Guess at Your Results
customer_reviews.text: by their own admission in their disclaimers, the results they give you are effectively a guess, rather than on true scientific principles; it is IMPOSSIBLE to have your parents both test 100% of the same ethnicity, and your test indicates you are their closest match as a child to both parents, but yet my results (72% of that same ethnicity for both parents) are substantially less than 100% of that same ethnicity; highly inaccurate and 23andMe produced the expected result (100%)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't include additional research
customer_reviews.text: Of course just after I received these (3), the Ancestry site had a deal for $59, down from $99. I couldn't return them because we used two right away. I'm just seeing this is sold by Ancestry on Amazon, so I probably could have gotten the lower price. The kit is simple to use and results are much quicker than stated - 3 weeks. We did not realize that the DNA test only includes limited results. In order to research anything, you need to pay for subscriptions.
customer_reviews.author: Me 9724548

customer_reviews.title: Reunited with Family
customer_reviews.text: Ancestry is so neat. I got this for my husband for Christmas and he loved it. So we ended up getting one for my father-in-law for Father’s Day and he connected with long lost family! He never knew who his dad was and his mom wouldn’t give him any information, but because of this, he found his dad as well as an entire side of the family he didn’t know existed. Turns out he has a few sisters! It’s amazing what technology can do nowadays, I am so grateful for this solving a decades long mystery.
customer_reviews.author: M Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Best gift ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and the year subscription for my girlfriend. She never knew her birth family, one year later she found them thanks to this. I can’t say how happy I am with this
customer_reviews.author: Paul Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Great service but inaccurate results
customer_reviews.text: The service provided by Ancestry was very fast & professional. I especially liked the emails which keep you up dated every step of the way (when your sample is received & how the processing is going). Unfortunately my results were either wrong or incomplete. My ancestry on my mother's side is very well documented & yet ancestry felled to identify 9% of my DNA which is well documented and which i have 1st hand knowledge of (in fact not even 1% of my DNA was connected to this group according to Ancestry).
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Bahadir

customer_reviews.title: There are additional fees if you want to find out information about your DNA Matches
customer_reviews.text: I loved the ability to find out about my heritage and ethnicity. The product was accurate based on what I knew of my background. It is difficult to find other information, i.e. which relatives may have been in the areas listed during which time period which my sister has on hers. I subsequently found out it would cost me an additional $200 ($99 for 6 months) per year to access this information. This was not clear to me when I purchased the kit. It is advertised as finding your relatives as well.
customer_reviews.author: Francine Mantopoulos

customer_reviews.title: AncestryDNA Will Show You the Way
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I was only interested in finding out my ethnicity breakdown. About a year after the results were found, I decided to see if I could actually find unknown relatives. Boy did I hit the jackpot. I have to say that I was more than a little skeptical. I’ve found aunts and uncles that I never knew existed. Some of my cousins and I have even communicated. If you’re curious, I can definitely recommend this test.
customer_reviews.author: Libros Lover

customer_reviews.title: I kept getting a message telling me that my password was not good, because it didn't have at least 8 characters
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately they were unable to analyze my sample an to follow instructions for a new kit. I didn't have a problem with that, until it was impossible to follow their instructions as to how I could get a new kit. I kept getting a message telling me that my password was not good, because it didn't have at least 8 characters. It had 11 characters, but it still didn't work. I tried to send a message, but that didn't work either. I am not happy wth Ancestry.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Kean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use very nice instructions and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use very nice instructions and convenient. The worst part is waiting for your results, my wife's results only took a couple of weeks mine took 2 months. It would be really cool if the trial ancestry.com membership lasted until your results come in, that way you have something to do while waiting for results, and you would get some kind of compensation for their long wait times. The results are interesting, but they could be better, I don't know exactly what I was expecting but the results seem pretty generic.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Green

customer_reviews.title: Was what I thought was OK...
customer_reviews.text: package was sealed. But the only thing that could 'go bad' per say was the blue stabilizer liquid that is supposed to be sealed and then seeped into your sample from the lid shipping once you screw it on. I didn;t realize that it was dried up so much until watching the intro video on my phone app after signing up. Mine barely had any blue liquid. I had already sent it in. Hopefully its OK.
customer_reviews.author: Losamohela

customer_reviews.title: Best sale price ever for a wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: My husband's family so enjoyed looking at how Ancestry worked with my test results when I was filling in his side of the family tree and this sale made it reasonable to gift his Aunts with tests. Shipped fast. Filling out your tree is free with an account, and people do have to pay a fee to research their tree and follow their hints for records, but Ancestry has to pay for access to many of the records so I understand it and don't mind. Around this time Ancestry also offered a $49 for 6 month subscription so it will be a fun Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Sheltiebrat

customer_reviews.title: No surprizes
customer_reviews.text: This product is well planned and designed, particularly in the web application. It does repeatedly steer you toward additional products to aid you in building a family tree. The report focuses on where your ancestors lived in 1750 (Roughly the time the modern borders of Europe formed). This is about the limit to which it is possible to trace anscestors by searching the paper trail. It would be interesting to focus the analysis on roughly the Roman times as the Romans found and named many tribes and assigned locations within the world known to Rome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend to Friends
customer_reviews.text: This works by comparing your dna sample with a database of roughly 16000 samples taken around the world. Takes a good while to get the results back. It pretty much paired up nicely with the research I've done on the ancestory site. I've heard experts claim that this method loses accuracy after the first half a dozen generations back or so. I guess that stands to reason if you consider the increased tendency of humans to homogenize among nationalities. It also stands to reason, however, that it will give you at least some idea of what area your ancestors were basically from. Controversial science? Maybe. Good fun and interesting? Definitely.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ramey

customer_reviews.title: I found my birth mother with Ancestry!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I actually found my birth mother with this kit! I have since bought one for every member of my family. My son's sample didn't have enough DNA, so they sent a replacement kit. Great customer service. It's so worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Multiple failed tests.  Over and over again.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product as a gift for our father and he has submitted multiple dna kits to be tested. Each one has failed. He is frustrated. We are frustrated. It was a waste of money. I have no idea how to request our money back at this point. This is ridiculous. I bought kits for my husband and I a few months later and they both worked the first time. I have been happy with this company until my father’s failed tests. I now owe him a $100 Father’s Day gift but there is no option to contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: D. Frownfelter

customer_reviews.title: I'm from where? What?
customer_reviews.text: The kit was super easy to use. Results were returned sooner than expected. Interesting dna results, some unexpected which made me encourage other family members to test. The only problem, which is huge, you have to pay for an expensive subscription to Ancestry.com to get the most out of finding relatives. Should be free with their kit purchase for atleast one year. This is a pretty unfortunate setback!
customer_reviews.author: boomom

customer_reviews.title: Only basic - Ancestry wants you to purchase more.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to just know the percentages of where you’re from then this is a great product. Unfortunately Ancestry.com wants you to purchase more and more. More for wanting to know Traits and also to use the website.
customer_reviews.author: Elyse Farris

customer_reviews.title: interesting background info on myself
customer_reviews.text: i was always debating about getting this done and finally did. i was pretty sure i was one thing, but with the results that were sent to me, i was surprised i was quiet a few different things. One thing i really liked is that with technology always advancing, so does this ancestrydna, i got my results in about 3 weeks time, which were one set of results, but as i said earlier, science got better and my results were fine tuned even further. i was even more accurate on my origins than before, well they were more accurate. so it seems if there's an update on your dna, the app will let you know, which is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Espinoza

product_meta.title: AncestryDNA: Genetic Ethnicity Test, Ethnicity Estimate, AncestryDNA Test Kit, Health and Personal Care
feature_bullets: A FEW SIMPLE STEPS: Discover your DNA story with our easy-to-follow instructions. Simply activate your DNA kit online and return your saliva sample in the prepaid package to our state-of-the-art lab. In roughly six to eight weeks, your results will be ready online.

TOP-SELLING CONSUMER DNA TEST: From your origins in over 1,000 regions to the most connections to living relatives, no other DNA test kit delivers an experience as unique and interactive as an AncestryDNA kit.

PRECISE ETHNICITY AND LIVING RELATIVES: A more precise ethnicity estimate with greater geographic detail and in-depth historical insights connects you to the places in the world where your story started—from unique regions to living relatives.

BUILD A FAMILY TREE: Combine what you learn from your DNA with an Ancestry subscription, for access to millions of family trees and billions of records, for even more insight into your genealogy and origins.

PROTECTING PRIVACY: When you send your DNA kit to us, we employ industry-standard security measures in every stage of our process, work to protect your data, and give you control over it—with data encryption, secure databases, and easy-to-use controls.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars14,064 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
